inn1.comm: starts a fraction too straight, clipped off the legs easily and they run three well
pitched up on off and tucked out for a single
ripper delivery - literally, it ripped straight past the outside edge as the batsman plays forward on the front foot down the channel... and misses
some encouraging swing as the ball goes down the off-side, and is helped on its way with a push off the back foot to third man
stays over the wicket to the left hander and nearly has him chopping on as Jayasuriya cuts off the back foot back and the inside edge crashes past the leg stump
outside off and Jayasuriya scintillates as he lifts the ball from a good length up and over extra cover, the ball goes soaring and lands just inside the rope, two bounces and it's four
in he runs, his self-proclaimed designer hair bobbing in the breeze, and the batsman plays out and they have to hurry through
short ball outside off, cut down to the man at gully off the back foot
tidy ball down off, good length and some encouraging carry through to the keeper, the batsman shouldering arms
through the channel again down off
cuts in from outside off on a good length, Jayasuriya pushes down in front of him, no more than a defence really, and they run through quickly. Good running
a fuller delivery, right up there on off, defended on the front foot right in front of the stumps
short ball in line with off, defended off the back foot into the track
fired hard across him, and he gets in a tangle as he tries to force the ball off the back foot to cover, it clatters down on him and he looks for the single

now, you shouldn't laugh but everyone else is, even Perera as he runs through for Jayasuriya's push-and-run, Lee runs out to get the ball and Perera trips over him, loses his bat, tries to grope his way forward and just about gets his hand back in by the time Symonds throws the stumps down
pushed outside off on a good length with some vicious wobble (if that's not an oxymoron, wobbles always seem so harmless)
more of the same, the batsman wise enough to leave on both occasions
and a similar kind of ball, at 152.7kph, to end a good - and certainly entertaining - over
gottim! Hasn't gottim! Bracken rolls his fingers on one of his favourite cutters, the ball pitches outside off, comes back in a long way off the seam and catches the pad on its way through
defended on the front foot this time
finds a good length, and a good width too, the ball defended on the front foot outside off
pushes this one flat down the channel, good carry through to the keeper and the batsman leaves it serenely
again Bracken gives nothing away, defended on the front foot tightly, not much else could be done there
more of the good line'n'length, he's churning them out by the hat-load, and again it's defended on the front foot
hey now, Lee is pitch perfect with his gleaming bouncer which would have clattered into the helmet were the batsman not quick enough to duck under
defended now, Lee quickly into his groove
a shout got stuck in his throat there as the ball, at 153kph, cut in from in line with off and would have crashed down leg
but he's got him this time...with a slower ball, a yorker which ducks in low and in line with middle, zooms under the bat and traps him plumb
defended on the front foot first up
lets that one go through, a leave in other words, to a decent length one outside off
the ball comes in at 131kph, and an inside edge turns down behind him
outside off, Sangakkara rocks back into the line and defends straight back down with a ramrod-straight bat
outside off, pushed back down off the back foot into the covers
pushed through outside off, a tight line, some good rise and it's as much as the batsman can do to leave the ball
another good delivery, outside off and Sangakkara goes fishing, Bracken planting the bait on the rise, and the batsman only just to say fails to connect
Sangakkara breathes a bit easier this ball, letting that one fly through, but again on a good length

Jayasuriya goes high and wide with a flashing outside edge down to deep third man, Hopes takes the catch but steps over at the same time, hardly his fault, there was nothing else he could have done there
a touch of width outside off, and Jayasuriya walks into a flashing cover-drive that takes just the one bounce before carrying over the line
hardly time to get his breath back, but we all take a breather with this one as the ball comes in on a good length in front of off and it's defended forward
the rollercoaster sets off again as he waits outside off and then frees his arms with a masterfully gentle steer down off the back foot behind point
a good-length delivery in line with off and Sangakkara defends forward
aims for the yorker, directly slightly outside off, and Sangakkara creeps up behind the ball and surprises it with a drive to cover, where it's picked up with ease
outside off, more than enough width for Jayasuriya to lash a back-foot late cut up and over third man

responds well with a tight one up on middle, pushed out and they scramble through as Bracken does his best soccer player impression, nearly dribbling on to the posts at the striker's end, but just wide. Goal kick
Bracken pushes outside off and the batsman is tempted, dangerously so, into coming out and playing at it, the ball leaps on naughtily, giggling to itself
a good line and length, this time prompting a defence on the front foot
the batsman rehearses his arms-shouldering this time as the ball slinks through on a good length just down the channel
outside off and Jayasuirya latches on to today's coup de choix with a blow up and out to third man
an overstepped no-ball now
he wanders across his stumps and Lee aims at leg stump, goes wide and gets called for it
the slower ball pays off, the batsman pushing out on the front foot and the ball skews to Haddin at midwicket
waits on the back foot and pushes out to the covers this time
outside off, waits on the back foot and plays down to wide third man
right up there on the legs, driven out to mid-on and the batsmen run through
a good leave down off on a good length, the batsman shouldering arms
tight delivery, up there in line with off, defended on the front foot
outside off, the batsman moves into the line of the ball and defends off the back foot
the ball climbs on him outside off and Jayasuriya prods an outside edge through on the front foot, Hussey takes the catch at first slip
fires this across the right hander, on a good length, who defends on the front foot
pushed through outside off
lets this one go through outside off once more
completes a wicket maiden in style, the ball going through just outside off, and left alone
turned round the corner through fine leg and that one goes all the way, a fine clip
comes out and defends on the front foot this time
defended on the front foot in line with off now
forces the forward defensive once more
outside off, defended back into the ground
outside off, Sangakkara leans into a cover-drive that tracers away as if on a marble surface
Bracken hits a good length again, the batsman defending on the front foot in line with off
pushes across the right hander Jayawardene who drives into the covers and the pair set off, Hopes throws back in and a direct shy would have had him out by more than a metre
waits on the back foot in line with off, and pushes into the covers
wiats outside off and defended on the front foot into the covers
a good length in line with off, pushed down into the leg side
on middle and off, tucked down from hip-height off the back foot and in front of square, an easy single for them
pushed up there on off, and defended in front of him
on line with off, defended on the front foot

boomed in from over the wicket in line with off, Sangakkara's head and bat go one way, the ball the other, hard through to Hussey who takes another catch at first slip, this one clinging on well with two hands
across the right hander who defends on the front foot
left alone this time
driven forward this time to round off yet another good over
stays over the wicket, fires across him on a good length and it's left alone
defended on the back foot into point
rolled up in front of off, full up there, and defended into the covers

outside off, pushed into midwicket and comes down for what he thought was an easy single, Jayawardene says no and is then nearly run out as he was dawdling outside his crease, Bracken's shy, if he had connected, would have had him as well
defended on the front foot outside off
jags the ball across the right hander, who tucks the bat behind his pad very quickly indeed, not at all interested as it licks down off
defended on the front foot in line with off this time
outside off and defended on the back foot into the covers
finds some extra bounce in the track there, generated from his action as he shoulders the boulder into the deck, short, and nearly takes Jayawardene's thumb as he defends down off the back foot
pushed into the covers on the front foot this time
defended on the front foot
a quick push forward
waits on the back foot to defend
a single guided down to third man
down off, left alone
ripped down off again, that nagging angle meaning the batsman is quick to leave it
outside off, pushed into the covers
a slower ball to finish, dropped in on off, the batsman not tempted to tangle with the dangle
tucked down on the back foot in front of off, the batsmen chase through cheekily, Johnson shies to the non-striker's to end their fun but doesn't pick up a coconut
driven out square to point and they scramble through quickly again
outside off, lets that one go through
driven out through the covers, a superb stroke from Jayawardene, peeled off the bat and that travelled to bring up the fifty
outside off, shortish, defended down on the back foot
pushed across him outside off, driven back into Hogg who's one of a number in an off-side half-moon, tries to hit, misses, laughs
outside off and laces a cover drive that rockets out to the rope
outside off, defended down off the back foot into the covers
waits and defends on the front foot, the batsmen shuttle through
pushed through on a good length down off, left alone outside off, shouldering arms and the like
nips back in a touch from outside off, the batsman tries to reel off a back-foot cover drive, and picks out the fielder instead
outside off, defended into the ground
good running from the pair who rush through after the ball's popped down diagonally away from him, only a metre or so, Johnson follows through and picks up the ball, attempting the underarm, misses
a hint of away swing as the ball curls away down off
pitches outside off, a good-length delivery sleeking through and there's another leave
good pace and carry again down off
outside off, thumped off the front foot to Symonds in the covers, who dives and cuts it off somehow
the ball goes across him and he defends down on the back foot behind him
width outside off, Jayawardene cuts hard off the back foot to point
a tidy ball on off, defended with a clamp. Well, with a bat
outside off, cut down off the back foot to the gully

comes in to him again outside off, a fair length turned down off the back foot to Lee at deep third man who fields, then has to stop his own hat... from flying off with the wind. It's a wide-brimmed number by the way
moved off the pitch, left him a touch, and Kapugedera leaves his bat dangling away from his body, the ball travelling on through to Gilchrist who takes it without alarm
played down off the back foot into the covers
wide outside off, cut down hard, and with good control, to point
short ball outside off, left alone through to the keeper
outside off, cut out to point
short ball outside off, defended back down without too much fuss
on middle, turned out behind square
down leg, turned down to fine leg, and there's now a free hit
boomed down leg, a bouncer, and it's wide on height, so another free hit results
on middle, and doesn't miss out, Jayawardene gives himself enough room to drive high and hard over long-off, the ball just plugging inside the rope and jumps over the rope
on leg, pulled round behind square
outside off, bent back towards the batsman
outside off, swept round behind square and it's zoomed back in

outside off,chopped down to third man where Clarke chases and Jayawardene could have been run out as Gilchrist took the return and then tried to hit the stumps at the non-striker's end. Jayawardene, who's riding his run-out lives today, would have been well gone
pitches outside off and moves away wider
turned down outside off, to third man
wide down off
outside off, short, and (de)fended into short midwicket
turned off the legs to midwicket and they get back comfortably
outside off, pierces the gap in the ring, but the sound of the bat hinted that it wasn't cleanly connected
outside off and left alone
worked to short midwicket off the back foot
outside off, pushed down the channel on a good length, and left alone
ooh, nearly chops back on from middle, the ball a bit too tight for doing that
turned back in to him, worked out to the legs
outside off, played down off the back foot to point
down leg, turned to short fine leg
comes on the front foot and defends into the covers
on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket
outside off, popped up off the back foot towards the covers, but in no danger.. for now
outside off, nearly chops back on with a drive into the ground
good length ball, up there on off, pushed into the covers
outside off, cut down through backward point
fired right up there in line with off, pushed out in a defensive manner
outside off, cut down off the back foot behind point and they get back for a comfortable two, Hogg doing the fielding
loop outside off, Jayawardene shuffles over, then leaves
picked off the legs and swivelled round behind square
comes out of his crease outside off, presses forward and will they run? "No!"
on middle, pulled round this time
looped up, driven out to the covers and there's a direct shy from Hogg but Jayawardene was just back in
turns back in from just outside off, and brushed out to short midwicket
clips in just outside off, the batsman eases out to point off the front foot
veering down leg, helpd round the corner and on to fine
outside off, cut down off the back foot to third man
nipped back in from outside off, defended on the front foot into the covers
nipped in again from outside off, defended on the front foot with no fuss
plugs the off-side channel again, turned down to third man
good loop on middle and leg, turned down to short fine leg and has to hurry through to the non-striker's, although Symonds' throw was just wide and even if it wasn't he probably would have been back
driven out to the covers and there's an overthrow, too
turned back in from off to in line with leg, defended down on the back foot
on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket, rather tried to, the ball crashing down in front of him
driven out to mid-on
on middle, good loop and length, eased out to mid-on
looped in a full toss, pushed out to the covers, cramped for room a touch
down leg, the batsman follows it round
on leg this time, pushed off down to short fine leg
down leg, pulled round through fine leg
down leg, gone through very fine indeed and Hussey does well to chase it down and then throws down the stumps at the striker's end, but the batsman was in
on leg, turned to midwicket
driven out straight
turned off the legs to Hussey at backward square
on off, bends in a touch to middle, and turned out to midwicket
more of the same, defended off the back foot into short square
on middle, turned out off the front foot to a short point
up there on off, defended on the front foot
on middle and leg, squeezed down to short fine leg
full delivery on off, chipped away well to midwicket
full delivery on off, driven back out to the bowler
low full toss, driven out to the covers
right up there on middle, turned to short fine leg, who wings it back in but the batsman is safe
tucked off the legs just behind square
on the legs, turned out behind square
turned back in, pushed off the back foot to the covers
squeezed out to point off the front foot to bring up a well-worked fifty from 65 balls
pushed back out to the bowler
dragged it short, pulled hard to the man at short midwicket
turned back in from outside off, defended back down with no fuss
outside leg, turned behind square for an easy single
a huge and sustained appeal as the umpire deliberates before giving him out, trapped on the front foot by the flipper, moving back in to middle and off
the batsman is quick to duck out of a searing bouncer that scorches past the helmet in line with off
down leg, turned down to deep fine leg
up there on off, defended on the front foot
turned down behind square from in line with off
full delivery, driven out to mid-on
banged in short down the channel, the batsman sways away
on middle, spinning into the pads
squares him up on off and he enters into a Chanderpaul-trademarked crab-like defence
driven forward this time
played off the legs to square
loop outside off and driven hard through the covers, pleasing the Sri Lankan contingent
on middle, stabbed down on it in defence and Gilchrist decides that's "Ooh, nice Hoggy"
tight ball on off, but driven out to mid-on for a quick single
outside off, driven to the man at cover
outside off, driven through the covers
on off, turned out in front of midwicket
a short ball now, pulled in front of square for four solid runs, well played
outside off, let it go through past him on a good length
comes down the track to meet a shortish one on middle, boomed round a pull to fine leg, the ball bouncing way in front of him
extra loop on middle, driven forward this time
turned back in from outside off, and guided out down to third man
on middle, pulled round to fine leg
outside off, deceived him there, but the batsman dips down his bat just in time
on off, the batsman turns it to square
a low full toss, driven out through straight mid-on and again the batsmen chance their running and get away with it
outside off, cut down to third man
outside off, cut down off the back foot behind gully
cut down to gully off the back foot
some wobble in the air, and cut down off the back foot to third man
short ball, didn't get hold of it as it was on to him faster than expected, the ball pops up to fine leg
turned away from outside off, and pulled over to square
outside leg, tucked down to square
looped up in line with off, driven out to long-off
turned away past the batsman outside off, left alone
turned back in outside off, defended down to gully off the back foot
turned past the outside edge, the batsman comes forward to defend
outside off, pulled back towards mid-on
outside off, cut into point, there's a shy and another miss
turned to short midwicket and they hammer through
pulled away behind square this time
outside off, pushed down to the gully off the back foot
on middle and leg, inside-edged safely into short midwicket
turned on off back into middle, and pulled round to fine leg
on the legs, turned down to short fine leg this time
on the legs, defended back down in front of him
on middle and leg, knocked down in front of square, just a push off the legs
big loop, attempted sweep from a straight delivery, gets some bat on it
on middle, driven out to mid-off for a single and the end of a good spell for Hogg for his last ball on this ground
outside off, waits and pulls hard up and over forward square leg, all his msucle behind that one to bring up an excellent fifty from 61 balls with two fours
pulled off the legs to square now
pushed out on the legs again
good line and length and beat him, past his outside edge as he pushed forward to defend outside off
outside off again, cut to point and Clarke tidies up
short ball, a good bouncer at 131kph, the batsman shapes to pull and is trhough with the shot
outside off, pushed down to gully, Dilshan sets off and is sent back, scrambles into his crease as the throw comes in
drives hard at it outside off but doesn't make contact
pushed across him from over the wicket, the batsman leaves it this time
squares up behind it on off, pushed out to point off the back foot
on off, strides out and drives to mid-on
outside off, the batsman cuts hard at it, but the ball splays wider
comes out and pulls hard through to long-on
outside off, defended back to the bowler
bouncer on middle, goes to hook it, the ball goes on over the helmet
on middle and leg, turned through the 45 off the hips
outside off, cut hard to backward point now
outside off, cut down off the back foot to third man
full toss outside off, goes for the firm pull and Hogg can't quite get around to it at long-off
driven out to mid-off and Bracken tidies up
outside off, driven out to deep extra cover
outside off, short ball, and pulled hard straight behind him for four, that raced to the rope off the top edge
outside off, cut down to third man
outside off, driven hard up and just over the top of the fielder at backward point, Clarke
that's past him, too good, outside off and the batsman stabs down defensively
goes for the yorker on leg, but that's a low full toss and driven out to straight long-on
on off, pushed forward and Hopes does well to run up and underarm on to the stumps, Dilshan goes
short ball outside off, the batsman sways out of the way of it
outside off, pulled forward to mid-on for a quick single
outside off, cut back in, pushed out off the back foot to short cover
short ball to finish the over, hopped away from
slower ball, guided out off the back foot to third man
attempted the yorker, pushed it a touch too wide, and it's cut away behind point
yorker on off, driven out to straight long-off
pushed down off
pushed again outside off
played down off the back foot to mid-on for another quick single
fired down off, the batsman leaves it alone on a good length
defended forward
driven out to mid-off for a quick single
outside off and driven to the covers this time
spears this one in just outside off, full again, and the batsman waits before working it down to third man
another overstep, so another free hit coming up, driven out to the covers meanwhile
the slower ball, but Lee doesn't profit as he did last time around, instead Silva pulls it round hard behind square
round the wicket, pitches it up there outside off and it's driven out to deep extra cover
on middle and off, swept round and Gilchrist puts in a half-shout, thinking that maybe it hit pad
outside off, pulled hard behind square for a well-struck four
over the wicket now, the batsman comes down the ground and drives up hard and high out to Johnson at long-on who holds on just below his neck
good yorker, dug out back towards Bracken who tidies up off his own bowling
low full toss, driven out to long-on this time
driven forward

short ball, which is pulled high and higher over towards Hopes who has to come in a fair few metres, the batsman not getting over it and he goes for a golden duck in the interests of trying to boost the score
short one goes over the head, the batsman ducks
into the legs, driven without much power to mid-on
right up there on off, driven back out to mid-off
pushed right up there and defended down behind point
on middle, and just not quite timed, the ball driven up to mid-on, just in front of Johnson
comprehensively yorked, Muralitharan backing away to try to club-cut to the covers and exposing his stumps which are subsequently shattered as he chops back on
outside off, drives hard, and an inside edge runs through the vacant third man area
a leading edge up to Symonds in the covers who fluffs the run-out chance at the non-striker's with the underarm
a half-volley and he laces it through the covers, the ball runs on all the way to the rope
slower ball aimed on off, the batsman goes to pull, is through the shot too quickly and leaves the hugest gap for the ball to go on and crahs into the top of off, leaving Bracken with four wickets

inn2.comm: Malinga bangs it in short of a length outside off, Gilchrist rocks back and chops it down the pitch
hits a good length and pitches it on off, Gilchrist gets covers the line and pushes back to the bowler
opens the face of the bat and slices it down to the covers, Gilchrist turns down the single
Gilly's underway.... Malinga grants him just a little width outside off Gilchrist stands tall and slices it swiftly in the arc between cover and extra cover, superb timing there
pitches outside off, Gilchrist chops it down hard to point
fullish outside the off stump, he gets across and chips it uppishly towards mid-off
slides on the pads and lands on a full length, he turns the face of the bat and works it to midwicket

big appeal... hits a good length outside off and curves in a little, Hopes goes on the backfoot and meets the ball very close to the pads in line with the stumps, Kulasekara appeals but the umpire reckoned there was bat on it. That was a really good shout nevertheless
gets a touch forward and works it just wide of mid-on
pitches outside off, he taps it just wide of cover for a single
strays on the pads, Hopes gets a long way across and works it wide of square leg and places it really square on the on side, allowing three comfortable runs
a little too full outside off and luckily for the bowler Gilchrist only places it straight to mid-off
gets a good stride forward, plays a forward defensive push just wide of mid-off, good running
fired in close to a yorker length, Gilchrist plays an inside out stroke, tries to work it to the on side but meets the ball off the slice and plays it third man instead
hits a good length on off stump, he gets a good stride forward and defends
bangs it in really short and that sails over Hopes' hunched back, wide called
hits a good length on middle, he gets across quickly and tucks it wide of square leg, the timing is good
better line, pitches outside off and draws Hopes forward, he defends solidly

brilliant placement and timing, hits a good length outside off and hust shapes away, Hopes gets forward, offers the full face and pushes it off the meat of the bat just wide of mid-off, the ball races away
gets forward just  a touch and pushes to mid-off
fuller in length, he drives straight along the pitch and Kulasekara does well to throw himself to his right and intercept that with one hand
pushes it in front of mid-off, he contemplates a single but decides against it
gets across his stumps on the backfoot and taps it to point with an angled bat
fired in fuller outside off, he chops it down hard on the pitch and just beats short cover, mid-off stops it
maiden over, he tucks it away quietly straight to midwicket
pitches it just short of a length outside off, Hopes offers the full face of the bat and pushes to mid-on
gets forward and drives hard straight to short cover
banged in short outside off, Hopes goes for the pull and manages to clear midwicket but the timing isn't how he would have liked
gets across and punches it straight to point this time
tucks him up a bit outside the offstump, he still covers the line well and pushes to the offside
pitches outside off, he gets across and slices it to the region of cover
short of a length on middle, Gilchrist pulls and clears square leg, luckily he checks his stroke as deep backward square-leg could have swallowed it
pushes it with soft hands just in front of mid-off and sets off quickly
full in length and slanting in, he once again covers the line with the full face of the bat and defends to the off side
gets across his stumps, turns the face of the bat a little and tucks it to mid-on
just holds the length back outside off, he gets a stride across and pushes it off the front foot to cover
slower ball, he waits on it, stays at the crease and softly taps it to the on side
pitches it up outside off, that's in the slot for Gilchrist as he scoops it through the line and carts it over mid-off
picks the ball on a fullish length outside off and tees off across the line, the ball is aerial for a long time, bounces a couple of times before the midwicket boundary. No real timing there
fullish on middle, he drives through the line and the bowler gets a finger to it on the dive
timing and distance.... hits a good length on middle, Gilchrist waits on it and reads the length very early as he pulls off the meat of the bat over square leg
drives away from the body and the inside edge nearly rolls onto his stumps
the over gets more expensive as Gilchrist scoops over the off side, the fielder at cover leaps and valiantly tries to pull off a blinder, the ball just stops before the rope
goes for an uppish drive, checks his stroke at the last second and nearly lobs it to mid-off, the ball beats the fielder on the dive and they pick up a single
well bowled.... fires in a yorker outside off and Gilchrist doesn't pick it at all as the ball creeps past the toe of the bat
gets forward and pushes to the off side
fired in close to a yorker length on middle, he gets across and works it straight to midwicket
full, just marginally wide outside off, Gilchrist gets forward on his knee, takes the ball on the full and executes a flashy square drive past backward point
attemps another yorker, gets forward, takes the ball on the full and just bisects the gap between mid-off and cover
starts down leg with a wide
wide of the crease and Hopes rocks back and follows the ball outside off, through teh shot too late
down on one knee and forces the sweep hard with a firm push through midwicket to bring the ominous Gilchrist back on strike
oh and Sri Lanka nearly had him fairly early too - Muralitharan trapping in from of middle and off, Gilchrist hadn't read the doosra and there didn't seem to much wrong with it, it kept low, too
into the legs and Gilchrist brushes at it, a half-shout only this time
Gilchrist goes over the top now, with a fluorishing drive over long-on, it plugs in the deep and then is chased down
comes in a touch from outside off, still outside the line when it's defended on the front foot
full ball outside off, pushed out through mid-off and Jayasuriya doesn't cover himself with glory as he lets the ball go through his legs
attempted yorker on middle, just a fraction short which is all Gilchrist needs to drive hard straight past the bowler who can't even start to get down to it by the time it's past him
outside off, and Gilchrist merely frees the arms and the ball flies off the thick edge down into the ground and on its way through third man
down leg, tries to swipe it round
outside off and there ideed is the fifty as he cracks the ball off the back foot through point and it rockets to the rope

the yorker dug out to Jayawardene at skipper-off as I call the position which is the shortest mid-off you'll ever see, a metre past the bowler's crease and also favoured by Michael Vaughan and Ricky Ponting, though usually in Tests
driven out to mid-off, quiet ball
round the wicket, Hopes works into the gap at short midwicket
outside leg and Gilchrist goes across to meet it, tickling a leg glance down
down leg a touch again, Gilchrist brushes it down
Gilchrist comes out of his crease now and drives hard through long-off, that one travelled, Murali was across and nearly stopped it with a dive to his left

Murali drags it a touch short and Gilchrist is immediately on to it, splaying his legs wide and setting himself to pull it just wide of mid-on. He then takes two paces and stops, knowing it's going to go all the way
outside off, driven out to mid-off, quiet stuff
short and wide outside off, cut hard behind point and the ball rolls on its merry way to the rope
outside off, just a fraction, Hopes tries to tuck it into leg, but tucks it into his own legs
a fraction short of a length and Hopes drives out to mid-on and Gilchrist is back on strike
straight bouncer and Gilchrist latches on with a swivel-pull of pure timing over midwicket
full on off, and driven out to long-off, they decide not to take the single
front-foot defended out to mid-on and Hopes gets Gilchrist back on strike
on leg, swept out to deep square
on the legs, swept down to the man at fine leg, Jayasuriya
pushes to the covers for a quick single and they run through
good use of the feet, Gilchrist comes down and drives back over mid-on for a one-bounce four, hit right through the line

comes out again and drives up and over straight, he doesn't even bother to take one step this time as he knows that's going to go to the boundary. Replays show that it was a six, so it must have hit the rope on the full
comes out and pushes back to the bowler
a huge shout for one which cuts back in outside off and would have gone on to hit off stump, but it matters not because it was bat first
outside off, pushed to short midwicket
on off and middle, pulled round in front of square, done for pace and it comes off the gloves, Hopes wasn't really sure where it had gone
stands tall, and defends on the back foot back towards the bowler
now it's Hopes's turn to shine, standing there and waiting to launch into a flowing drive which goes up and over the bowler and loops down just before the rope
placed into short midwicket for a quiet single
on off, turned round the corner to leg gully
reaches just outside off to sweep to midwicket

ah, what's gone on here, the ball past him and nudges the off stump and the bail comes off, it takes a while to realise he's actually bowled, as it could also have been a stumping by Sangakkara and Hopes had moved in front of the stumps so you couldn't see at first look whether he was bowled or not
turned back in from outside off, defended on the back foot
comes right out, looking to attack, but ends up defending on the front foot
short outside off  Gilchrist cuts hard off the back foot behind point
full delivery outside off, driven out to extra cover and they come back well for two
outside off and pulled up safe out to long-on and they come back for two, the ball coming up off the base of the bat

fabulous catch by Malinga! Gilchrist goes for the aerial drive once more, booming the ball up to long-off where Malinga charges round and takes the ball in front of him on the slide, great catch to end a great innings
outside off, short, pushes off the back foot into the covers and follows up with a call of "Waiting!"
right up there on off, defended on the front foot
cut back in from outside off on a good length, the batsman drives into his legs
on off, climbing from a good length, the batsman defends into the covers
outside off, driven back to the bowler
outside off, driven off the back foot to the covers
on to the legs and tucked out behind square
on off and middle, tight again, driven back out straight
defended on the front foot
pushed on to the legs, and turned back out to fine leg
pushed up there on the front foot again, defended forward
cut in from outside off, defended once more
slower ball, outside off deceives the batsman who drives out just short of the man at cover
full toss dips on to the pads, the batsman drives back forward to bring up successive maidens for the bowlers
defended forward
short ball on off, flicked hard off the legs to fine leg
cleans him up with a beauty! Clarke's gone for a duck and starts the long walk back after the ball pitched outside off and nipped back to hit the stumps
nipped back in from outside off, tucked into short midwicket
defended this time
and more defence to round off another good over in an encouraging period for Sri Lanka
forced on to the front foot to defend
and more defence, Australia taking their time to regroup
a great ball to dismiss Ponting, beating his outside edge as he squares up to get behind it, the ball pitching outside off and would have gone on to take middle and off
right up there in line with middle, defended on the front foot
pushed outside off, left alone on its way through
good length outside off and the ball skids through to round off a wicket maiden off
down leg and Symonds appears to have strangled it through to the keeper, there was certainly a snick and indeed he has been given!
good swing back in to the right hander who presses forward on a good length
right up there in line with middle, defended on the front foot
outside off and again Amerasinghe is up with arms, appealing loudly but although the ball cut back in from outside off there was a huge, huger, hugest inside edge back on to the pads
on the legs, turned out to short midwicket
a hint of swing again, width outside off and cut out to point to round out yet another wicket maiden
that was as close as you can get to a wicket without taking one, the ball pitching just outside off and nearly taking the outside edge as it pitches on off and licks through
up there on off and defended on the front foot
outside off, lets it go through
another good delivery, similar to the opening ball of this over and Malinga's broad smile tells you how much he liked that, the ball hitting the seam and moving out past the outside edge
the batsman shoulders arms as the ball goes through

a mix-up, oh dear, Sri Lanka should have had a wicket there as the batsmen get their calling wrong and set off, then have to get back, Haddin is way out but the fielder makes a hash of it and the throw is then wide
comes back in from outside off, defended on the front foot
swung in on to the legs, and clipped out to short midwicket
outside off, overpitched, and Haddin drives out to deep midwicket
turned off the legs to fine leg and there's some good running between the wickets
swing down leg and that's given wide, correctly
outside off, defended down on the back foot
...and there's another one, driven out over mid-on
outside off, full delivery, pushed into the ground back towards the cover
cracking yorker right up there on middle and the umpire needed only a fraction of a second to put up the finger. Haddin was completely beaten with the change of pace there, stabbing down on the ball
stabbed into the ground outside off, there was not much more he could have done with that one
full delivery on off, driven out to the deep cover region where it's well chased by Dilshan
on off, stabbed down into the gully region this time
yorker on off and an overthrow from some enthusiastic fielding
good loop on off, the batsman waits and patiently pushes back into the ground
pitches on middle, works out across him and he guides it down to third man
on leg, moves across to off on a good length and Hussey gets over it to defend
defended on the front foot
overpitched on off, Hussey drives out to mid-off and is off the mark after 12 balls
overpitched on off again, this time it's driven out to mid-on
wide outside off, cut out to point
a would-be yorker clipped well off the pads behind square
outside off, a hint of swing, Hussey drives straight to Dilshan at cover
a full delivery just outside off, Hussey gets right over the ball to the covers
full delivery, driven back to the bowler who parries it to Kulasekera at mid-on
outside off and the ball kept low as Hussey drove at it outside off
up there outside off, pushed forward and they shuffle through
width outside leg, Hussey chases it down leg
outside off, driven out with ease to long-off
starts outside leg, just to say turns back in to leg and it's whipped down off the hips to short midwicket
fired across him this time and nearly catches the edge as Hogg shapes to cut off the back foot
outside off and cut down to gully
defended on the front foot
pushed off the front foot to short midwicket this time
nipped back in from outside off, defended back down off the back foot
wide outside off, the batsman has to stretch out to cut it down to point
right up there on off, driven out straight and there's a fumble by Silva at straight mid-on who didn't  pick it up cleanly - if he had there was every chance of a run-out
nipped back in outside off and cut down to third man for an easy single
too short outside off, not to mention wide, and cut down in front of point
fired down outside off, left alone
spins it right in on the toes, and it's clipped in front of square
stands firm on the front foot and defends down
turned out square for a quick single
turned off the legs to leg gully and they wisely decide not to run
pushed right up there on off and defended forward
room outside off to cut down to third man
terrific delivery to clean bowl Hussey, the ball curling in and knocking back the stumps, the batsman caught in the crease as he stands back to defend
outside off, cuts back in at the batsman who pushes it out to gully on the back foot
defends very firmly on the front foot, the head deliberately low
on middle and off, pushed off the legs to short midwicket and the batsmen scramble desperately
a quick single, they scramble through
outside off, pushed back in and defended forward on the front foot, trapping the ball down
the first boundary since the 14th over, as Lee drives a firm cover drive through
a huge shout from bowler and keeper as the ball pitches outside off and came back in to hit somewhere around leg and possibly going over
defended on the front foot
the sweep shot and a throaty appeal but the umpire isn't interested, the ball was probably going down there
a very wide outside off but Sangakkara takes it well, snapping to his left at knee-height
driven out square to point
pushed up there outside off, some movement off the seam, and defended down off the back foot
driven back to the bowler this time
outside off, pushed back into the ground and the ball balloons up to the bowler who catches it and some fo the crowd think he's gone
pushed forward, Lee doesn't really know where it's gone, they think of running through but it's too close for comfort
outside off, cut down hard off the back foot to gully
turned back in on middle, and peeled back out off the back foot to gully
dug out off the legs to midwicket
on the legs, pushed on to the back foot and driven back out to mid-on
pushed on to the back foot again, and defended back down into the cover region
stabs down on it, looking to take the ball from outside off to short midwicket, stops on the shot rather
another sudden stab, Lee coming forward and all he can do is defend, watching the ball on to his bat in front of off
turns back in from outside off, and pushed out to point
tight ball again, driven back out off the back foot
very wide outside off, again Sangakkara does well to snap it up
curls back in on off and driven out to mid-on
on off and driven hard back to the bowler
tidy delivery, up there on off, and driven back out to mid-on
outside off, cut down to deep cover
on the legs, some testing bounce as the ball rips past the outside edge, Hogg hiding the bat behind the pad
pushed forward into the covers, Murali over the wicket by the way
pushed past him again, Hogg has no answer and his grin shows he knows it, too
outside off, pushed down to gully, the batsman comes out looking for the single and is sent back
a huge shout from Sangakkara as Muralitharan plants the ball on middle and leg, Hogg presses forward too late and is rapped in line with off
outside leg, punched out to square off the back foot
full delivery, in line with middle and off, driven out to the short cover
outside off, the batsman drove back into his pads
on the legs, clipped in front of midwicket and they charge through
pushed up there and driven back into the ground towards the bowler
slower ball, tight up there on off, driven back to him and he picks up the ball well
turned off the legs to midwicket
round the wicket, pitches on off, Lee practises the stabbing defence once more
comes down the track outside off and drives hard through the covers
past the outside edge, not much Johnson could do ans he was beaten outside off as he tried to defend
and again, the rip past him too much for Johnson to deal with
outside off, defended on the back foot into the pitch
the best ball of the lot, again past Johnson's outside edge and Sangakkara was ready for if he fell out of his crease as he looked like he could have done when stumbling forward
outside off, a firm cut off the back foot, right over the ball
defends right over it
full ball on leg, driven out to mid-on
pushed up there on the front foot
short ball and hit well over long-on
driven to mid-off
driven out to mid-on
defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot this time
outside leg, pushed down on the front foot, defensively
played off the legs to midwicket for two
beaten past the outside edge, Lee forced on to the back foot and defends down the wrong line completely as the ball veers on

catch of the night, sends tingles down the spine, and an inspired change too by the same man Jayawardene. Well bowled, drawing him into the drive, and a thick edge skews very wide of Jayawardene at first slip but he leaps out of nowhere with a horizontal dive to snatch it to his left
lets that through outside off
some nasty swing to negotiate, defended on the front foot on a good length
right up there on off, and defended on the front foot back into the crease
outside off, cut down off the back foot through gully and they come back for two
a very firm forward defensive this time in front of off
a full delivery on off has Lee hopping into a forward defensive
outside off and Lee nearly chopped that back on to leg stump
full yorker on off, dug out to mid-off this time
very full on off, Malinga loves his yorkers, and Bracken defends into the covers
swung up there again, driven out to the covers
dug out at the legs and the ball goes out to mid-on
outside off, driven out in front of point
followed him as he backed away to leg and he dug out the ball with an upward push to mid-on
swung in on middle, defended on the front foot into the covers
swing again, this one around a line on off, and Lee drives out to mid-off
a big defensive and an inside edge crashes away past the leg stump and on its way. It's not over yet

swing down leg, clipped off the pads to fine leg and a wide throw allows the extra run, not quite an overthrow because it didn't really get past the sticks, more it was right in the middle of both sets of stumps
outside off, cut hard off the back foot through third man
straight bouncer, Lee sways back again
a terrific bouncer which nearly catches the upper edge as Lee shapes to cut off the back foot over gully
goes for the yorker but Lee reaches out and makes it into a full toss, the outside edge flicking hard down to third man
strikes Bracken with the bouncer, the batsman shaped to duck and it skidded on through to his shoulder
wide down leg this time, no question there
outside off and there was a woody click, but that was bat being stabbed into ground as the ball whistled through, keeping quite low
slower ball, picked, and driven out straight and true to long-off
right up there on off, a tight line, and Bracken defends back down
a nippy bouncer through outside off, Lee thinks that should have been wide, shaking his head at the other end
defended into the covers on the front foot
outside off, pushed to the covers, "Yayayayaya" they call as they shuffle through
short ball on middle, defended sturdily off the back foot

round the wicket and a huge shout immediately from Sangakkara, clearing his lungs, as it pitches in line and may have gone on past leg. The umpire shook his head immediately, possibly also for height reasons
defended on the front foot this time
on middle and leg, played off the legs out behind square for a quick single
this one went straight on and he played inside the line of it, striding right out to defend, almost on the floor, and Sangakkara whips off the bails for insurance
defended on the front foot, more orthodox this time
outside off, ripped past him, another play and miss
good yorker, at 133kph on off, defended forward
low full toss on the legs, tucked off in front of square
on the legs, pushed out to mid-on this time
outside off, close to the inside edge, the batsman whooshing out at it to mid-off
on off, driven out wide to mid-on
outside off, driven into the legs
not much wrong with that delivery, but Lee stabs out through third man to bring up the 200
stabs down on it in defence, a great yorker that one
outside off, a good drive through the covers for one, meaning it's exactly a run a ball required
outside off, rising and Bracken waits on the back foot, and opens the face to guide the ball to third man
full delivery on off stump, dug back out to the bowler
yorker, dug out by Lee to the covers
yorker on off, clipped out to short midwicket
another yorker, this time slightly outside off, and driven to Jayasuriya at mid-on who would have got him out with a direct hit
outside off, cut into the ground off the back foot and they hasten through
right up there on off, a dot ball builds the pressure there as Bracken defends back into the turf
on the legs, pushes out deep square where Malinga fires it back in
on off, driven out to mid-on and they looked for the two, Bracken says "No" and that means Lee is back on strike

another inspired decision by Jayawardene! Jayasuriya strikes with his first delivery of the match at a crucial time, the batsman trying to pull across the line and he got an inside edge back on to leg stump and all the stumps wobble
